author: Jess Bravin
title: Supreme Court to Consider Whether Alabama Can Execute Inmate With Dementia
text:
WASHINGTON—The Supreme Court agreed Monday to consider whether the Constitution forbids executing an Alabama inmate who has no memory of the murder he committed after a series of strokes left him with vascular dementia.
Vernon Madison was slated to die Jan. 25, but the Supreme Court stepped in that day to block his execution while weighing whether to hear his claim. Three conservative justices—Clarence Thomas, Samuel Alito and Neil Gorsuch—opposed granting the stay of execution last month, but Monday’s order noted no dissents.
